name: Shadow Bane.  Just wanted your guys opinion and help on this one.

So first time really doing this, so pick away. I Need help on skill points and optimizing. This server is pretty easy to get to 40 so playability is not that imporant 1-40.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You forgot to take Favored Enemies at levels 5 and 10.
You didn't say, but I guess you're increasing DEX at levels 4, 8, 12, etc. which will give you and ending DEX of 32.
With your 14 INT, you only need 18 Spellcraft, because Spellcraft uses your net score, and you'll get the other 2 from INT. Alternatively, you could max out your Spellcraft , which would be 21(23 with INT bonus) and get some more from equipment.
Maybe put points in Concentration to resist being taunted.
I don't know your server, so I don't know how useful are skills for crafting, Lore, Appraise, or Heal.

Hopefully, others with more experience with Rangers and/or Assassins will come along with further feedback.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Oops, I fixed the FE for 5 and 10. Yes all points go into Dex. I play on a server called Sinfar. thanks for your input.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This build would be hard to level to 20, but I understand that this is not a concern. Make sure that you have all player sub-races covered as FEs and then the most likely shifted races like dragon and perhaps undead and outsider.
If you want discipline 43, you have to take the last ranger level at 40. But I doubt that discipline is worth it here, since your main tactics will be attacking from stealth and your AC probably will be better than your discipline rank anyway.
Normally I would have taken a level of SD for HIPS unless ranger or assassin are altered and get it at some point.
This build is a bit half and half. Assassin is not optimized with only 19 levels and ranger is just enough for BoE. More ranger will give a better damage vs FEs. More assassin will secure a higher DA DC and more DA damage. You will need just 9 levels of assassin for the II spell-likeability. 13 levels of rogue will offer ED. But you will need more than 40 levels to qualify for them all: BoE, the II spell and ED (Edit: unless you take SD10 rather than rogue 13 for ED).

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: On this server lvl 8 Assassin gives you HiPS. I really like Rangers and wanted the BOE, I also wanted some sort of sneak attack so I went Assassin instead of Rogue because of the HiPS. Just dont know If I should keep it the way it is or go more Ranger? I am playing it as a sneak though stick and move.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
campgod wrote:
On this server lvl 8 Assassin gives you HiPS. I really like Rangers and wanted the BOE, I also wanted some sort of sneak attack so I went Assassin instead of Rogue because of the HiPS.

 
That makes sense. Why don't you try to replace one of the assassin levels for monk and dual wield Kamas for 10 attacks per round with flurry of blows active and hasted? Are the exotic daggers worth it in that perspective?

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Ill play around with the one monk lvl and see what happens. I believe that they give you a AB bonus for single and duel classes, but I'll have to check on that. The crafting system is based on what they call a PP system and diffenert weapons can hold more enchants. Kama's are only allowed 2 PP, which would let me just but +6 enhancment. Whlie the Sai (the weapon in the dagger family but needs exotic weapon) holds 6 PP. With that many I can fit on each weapon, +6 enchanment,keen,1d6 ele damage.

Perhaps enough UMD to use a stack of Darkness scrolls and some self-buffing cleric scrolls?  Dunno how your server handles the scroll check so you may not need all that much.  Mord scrolls bartered from a friendly arcanist scriber would be ideal with a high enough investment in the skill.
